thread.title: The 24 current Premier League stars most likely to move to China... according to the bookies
thread.title_full: The 24 current Premier League stars most likely to move to China... according to the bookies

author: Mark Jones
title: The 24 current Premier League stars most likely to move to China... according to the bookies
text:
Sport The 24 current Premier League stars most likely to move to China... according to the bookies The Chinese Super League is all the rage these days, and Ladbrokes have told us who are the most likely players to move from the Premier League to the Far East Share Will these three head to the Far East? (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
It might not be January any more, but that doesn't mean that we can forget all about transfers. 
And given that the Chinese Super League's transfer window is still open all throughout February, players can still move to the world's most newly glamorous league for the next month. That means you, Diego Costa . 
But while we all know about the Chelsea star's flirtation with a move to the Far East, who else could make the switch? It's no wonder he's the favourite... (Photo: Reuters) 
We asked bookies Ladbrokes to give us a list of the most likely players to make the move from the Premier League to China at ANY POINT in their career, and they came back with these 24 names. Diego Costa - 1/3 He can levitate, too (Photo: Darren Walsh) Yaya Toure - EVS Will Yaya dawdle off to China? (Photo: Getty Images) Christian Benteke - 11/8 Could the big Belgian be on the move? (Photo: Bryn Lennon) Romelu Lukaku - 11/8 Or even this big Belgian? (Photo: Getty Images) Wayne Rooney - 6/4 If Wayne is on the wane, then would China make sense? (Photo: Getty) Gabriel Jesus - 6/4 He's only just arrived at City, but could China be next? (Photo: Steve Bardens) Ashley Young - 13/8 He's not as Young any more, so could he be off? (Photo: Mark Thompson) Philippe Coutinho - 7/4 He's only just signed a new contract, but we all know what that can mean... (Photo: REUTERS) Sergio Aguero - 2/1 Could Sergio make the move? (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Eden Hazard - 9/4 Well Real Madrid don't seem to want him any more... (Photo: Clive Mason) Roberto Firmino - 9/4 Could Firmino go to the Far East? (Photo: Reuters) Alexis Sanchez - 5/2 Would Atom and Humber like it in China? (Photo: REUTERS) Marouane Fellaini - 11/4 Could the big man go? (Photo: Reuters) Joe Hart - 11/4 Where will Hart go after Torino? (Photo: Getty) Daniel Sturridge - 4/1 Well he'd probably get more of a game (Photo: Alex Livesey/Getty Images) Marcus Rashford - 9/2 Would a big money offer tempt the youngster? (Photo: REUTERS) Olivier Giroud - 9/2 Time for Giroud to chase the money? (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Harry Kane - 9/2 Would Harry turn his back on Spurs? (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) Raheem Sterling - 5/1 He's already made one big move... (Photo: Getty Images) Adam Lallana - 5/1 Maybe he'd run all the way to China? (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) Jamie Vardy - 6/1 He could do with a change of scenery... (Photo: Getty) Mesut Ozil - 7/1 Would Arsenal's assist king be tempted? (Photo: Shaun Botterill) Andy Carroll - 8/1 Another big switch for the big man? (Photo: Ian MacNicol/Getty) John Terry - 8/1 Will JT wave goodbye? (Photo: AFP) 
Richard Marsh of Ladbrokes News said: "The only way is China, and over the next few years we expect to see more and more of the Premier League's established names head east, starting with Diego Costa and Yaya Toure." 
Seems about right, doesn't it? 
And given the sums of money involved, it'll be nice work if you can get it. poll loading Is the Chinese Super League ruining football? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
